### Data Integrity with Purview #### Key Concepts - **Definition**: Ensuring accuracy, consistency, and reliability of data over its lifecycle. - **Validation**: Regular checks and rules ensure that data stays error-free. - **Version Control**: Maintains data history and changes for traceability. - **Lineage Tracking**: Monitors the origin and transformations of data. - **Integrity Audits**: Periodic reviews to assess and validate data quality. #### Purview Features - **Data Map**: Offers a detailed view of data origins and usage. - **Data Policy Enforcement**: Automates rules to maintain consistent data standards. - **Metadata Management**: Ensures every piece of data has descriptive context. - **Automated Quality Checks**: Regularly performs integrity validations. - **Alerts and Notifications**: Flags anomalies to ensure immediate attention. #### Best Practices - **Regular Backups**: Maintain frequent copies of data for recovery purposes. - **Access Controls**: Restrict and monitor who can alter data to prevent unauthorized changes. - **Transparent Processes**: Document procedures for data handling and maintenance. - **Training and Awareness**: Ensure staff understand best practices for data integrity. #### Benefits - **Accuracy**: Ensures reliable data-based decisions. - **Regulatory Compliance**: Meets standards set by legal frameworks. - **Business Trust**: Builds confidence in data-driven processes. - **Operational Efficiency**: Reduces errors, rework, and improves workflow
